abstract: Attorney for former Boston mob boss James (Whitey) Bulger says his client's multiple federal racketeering convictions should be overturned because his constitutional rights were violated when he was prevented from testifying in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The lawyer for the former Boston mob boss James (Whitey) Bulger went before a three-judge federal panel in Boston on Monday.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Bulger Wanted to Testify at His Trial, His Lawyer Argues
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Bulger Wanted to Testify at His Trial, His Lawyer Argues

snippet: The lawyer for the former Boston mob boss James (Whitey) Bulger went before a three-judge federal panel in Boston on Monday.
